column4: dpkg: error processing sun-j2sdk1.4_1.4.2+18_i386.deb (--install): package architecture (i386) does not match system (amd64)
You are using a 32bit deb on a 64 bit system
so how can I make it work?
but I have a 64bit CPU which supports 32bit binaries
I cant make the 64bit binaries because make-jpkg fails
what are you trying to do
I am trying to build a deb package from java's JDK version 1.4 bins
I want to have a JDK 1.4 installation as well as a JDK 1.6
unless I'm mistaken.. you need 64bit version of files
so I can't tell dpkg to force install?
ubuntu has different repos for 64bit and 32bit
ok so how do I mangle a 32bit package to to be a 64bit package?
I have no idea.. if pkg is difficult to find.. I would just compile from sources..
